unnormalised: **Subject: Builder Reviews - How important are they, really? And where can I find legit ones in Mumbai?**
normalised: **Subject: Builder Reviews - How important are they, really? And where can I find legit ones in Mumbai?**

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Building a new house (or buying one from a builder) is a HUGE investment, right? Like, my entire life savings level investment. So, obviously, you want to pick a good builder. That's where builder reviews come in.
normalised: Hey everyone! Building a new house (or buying one from a builder) is a huge investment, right? Like, my entire life savings level investment. So, obviously, you want to pick a good builder. That's where builder reviews come in.

unnormalised: But are they *actually* useful? I mean, I've seen some online that seem totally fake, either ridiculously glowing or completely trashy. How do you tell what's genuine?
normalised: But are they *actually* useful? I mean, I've seen some online that seem totally fake, either ridiculously glowing or completely trashy. How do you tell what's genuine?

unnormalised: Specifically, I'm looking for reliable builder reviews in Mumbai. I'm considering purchasing a flat in a project near Powai, and the builder is "Sharma Constructions." Has anyone had any experience with them? I’m scheduled to visit the site on 27/10/2024 at 11:00 hrs.
normalised: Specifically, I'm looking for reliable builder reviews in Mumbai. I'm considering purchasing a flat in a project near Powai, and the builder is "Sharma Constructions." Has anyone had any experience with them? I’m scheduled to visit the site on twenty seventh october two thousand and twenty four at eleven o'clock.

unnormalised: I remember my Uncle Rajesh getting burned badly by a builder back in 2010, promised the moon and delivered… well, nothing. He's still fighting legal battles, it's a real headache! Don't want a repeat of that saga.
normalised: I remember my Uncle Rajesh getting burned badly by a builder back in two thousand and ten, promised the moon and delivered… well, nothing. He's still fighting legal battles, it's a real headache! Don't want a repeat of that saga.

unnormalised: Also, aside from online reviews, are there other ways to check a builder’s reputation? Maybe checking with the RERA or something? I've heard whispers of complaints piling up against some builders, but nothing concrete.
normalised: Also, aside from online reviews, are there other ways to check a builder’s reputation? Maybe checking with the R E R A or something? I've heard whispers of complaints piling up against some builders, but nothing concrete.

unnormalised: Any insights or advice from folks who've been through this process in Mumbai would be greatly appreciated! Even a simple "Avoid them like the plague!" is helpful. Trying to avoid a disaster scenario before Diwali on 01/11/2024.
normalised: Any insights or advice from folks who've been through this process in Mumbai would be greatly appreciated! Even a simple "Avoid them like the plague!" is helpful. Trying to avoid a disaster scenario before Diwali on first november two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: Thanks in advance for your help! Want to buy a good house so that my kids can study well and maybe even crack the IIT entrance exam after 18 years in 2042.
normalised: Thanks in advance for your help! Want to buy a good house so that my kids can study well and maybe even crack the I I T entrance exam after eighteen years in two thousand and forty two.
